column3: was a close friend of Ælfwine.

the http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danes Danes attacked http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Porlock Porlock. They were at first driven off and Ælfwines company managed to capture a Danish http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knarr cnearr at night. At dawn Ælfwine told to his closest friend
column5: he intended to sail off westward
column6: perhaps to the country of the legendary king http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sceafa Sheaf. Tréowine agreed to accompany him at least as far as to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ireland Ireland. They got two other companions: Ceola of Somerset and Geraint of http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Wales West Wales.

column1: Many days after they passed Ireland the voyagers were exhausted. A "dreamlike death" seemed to come over them
column2: and soon they passed out. The last that is known of the journey is that Tréowine saw the world plunge down under them
